item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "It was as if that great rush of anger had washed me clean, emptied me of hope, and, gazing up at the dark sky spangled with its signs and stars, for the first time, the first, I laid my heart open to the benign indifference of the universe. To feel it so like myself, indeed, so brotherly, made me realize that I'd been happy, and that I was happy still. For all to be accomplished, for me to feel less lonely, all that remained to hope was that on the day of my execution there should be a huge crowd of spectators and that they should greet me with howls of execration." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Megan add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I leave Sisyphus at the foot of the mountain. One always finds one's burden again. But Sisyphus teaches the higher fidelity that negates the gods and raises rocks. He too concludes that all is well. This universe henceforth without a master seems to him neither sterile nor futile. Each atom of that stone, each mineral flake of that night-filled mountain, in itself, forms a world. The struggle itself toward the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "For if there is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life and in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Megan add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Megan add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "For the survivor who chooses to testify, it is clear: his duty is to bear witness for the dead and for the living. He has no right to deprive future generations of a past that belongs to our collective memory. To forget would be not only dangerous but offensive; to forget the dead would be akin to killing them a second time." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And so it goes..." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Like so many Americans, she was trying to construct a life that made sense from things she found in gift shops." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "All this happened, more or less." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Where do I get my ideas from? You might as well have asked that of Beethoven. He was goofing around in Germany like everybody else, and all of a sudden this stuff came gushing out of him. It was music. I was goofing around like everybody else in Indiana, and all of a sudden stuff came gushing out. It was disgust with civilization." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "As for literary criticism in general: I have long felt that any reviewer who expresses rage and loathing for a novel or a play or a poem is preposterous. He or she is like a person who has put on full armor and attacked a hot fudge sundae or a banana split." -- kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "When I write, I feel like an armless, legless man with a crayon in his mouth." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "No good at life, but very funny sometimes with the commentary." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here we are, trapped in the amber of the moment. There is no why." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein
